action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: this is a common five-letter English word with a good mix of vowels and consonants, useful for gathering information about letter positions.
guess: table

attempts = 1
target_word = squat
guess = table
guess_feedback = t<yellow> a<yellow> b<red> l<red> e<red>

guess_feedback: t<yellow> a<yellow> b<red> l<red> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "t" and "a" are in the word but not in the correct positions; "b", "l", and "e" are not in the word. I will try "actor" to test new positions for "a" and "t" and introduce new letters.
guess: actor

attempts = 2
target_word = squat
guess = actor
guess_feedback = a<yellow> c<red> t<yellow> o<red> r<red>

guess_feedback: a<yellow> c<red> t<yellow> o<red> r<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "a" and "t" are in the word but still not in the correct positions; "c", "o", and "r" are not in the word. I will try "stamp" to test new positions for "a" and "t" and introduce "s", "m", and "p".
guess: stamp

attempts = 3
target_word = squat
guess = stamp
guess_feedback = s<green> t<yellow> a<yellow> m<red> p<red>

guess_feedback: s<green> t<yellow> a<yellow> m<red> p<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "s" is in the correct position (first), "t" and "a" are in the word but not in the correct positions, and "m" and "p" are not in the word. I will try "saint" to test new positions for "a" and "t" and introduce "i" and "n".
guess: saint

attempts = 4
target_word = squat
guess = saint
guess_feedback = s<green> a<yellow> i<red> n<red> t<green>

guess_feedback: s<green> a<yellow> i<red> n<red> t<green>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "s" and "t" are in the correct positions (first and fifth), "a" is in the word but not in the second position, and "i" and "n" are not in the word. I will try "strap" to test "a" in a new position and introduce "r" and "p".
guess: strap

attempts = 5
target_word = squat
guess = strap
guess_feedback = s<green> t<yellow> r<red> a<green> p<red>

guess_feedback: s<green> t<yellow> r<red> a<green> p<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "s" and "a" are in the correct positions (first and fourth), "t" is in the word but not in the second or fifth positions, "r" and "p" are not in the word. I will try "stoat" to place "t" in the third position and introduce "o".
guess: stoat

attempts = 6
target_word = squat
guess = stoat
guess_feedback = s<green> t<red> o<red> a<green> t<green>

guess_explanation: this is a common five-letter English word with a good mix of vowels and consonants, useful for gathering information about letter positions.
"t" and "a" are in the word but not in the correct positions; "b", "l", and "e" are not in the word. I will try "actor" to test new positions for "a" and "t" and introduce new letters.
"a" and "t" are in the word but still not in the correct positions; "c", "o", and "r" are not in the word. I will try "stamp" to test new positions for "a" and "t" and introduce "s", "m", and "p".

"s" is in the correct position (first), "t" and "a" are in the word but not in the correct positions, and "m" and "p" are not in the word. I will try "saint" to test new positions for "a" and "t" and introduce "i" and "n".

"s" and "t" are in the correct positions (first and fifth), "a" is in the word but not in the second position, and "i" and "n" are not in the word. I will try "strap" to test "a" in a new position and introduce "r" and "p".

"s" and "a" are in the correct positions (first and fourth), "t" is in the word but not in the second or fifth positions, "r" and "p" are not in the word. I will try "stoat" to place "t" in the third position and introduce "o".
